message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper deals with action segmentation and recognition using kinematic and accelerometer data, which are commonly used in computer vision and machine learning applications. The use of discriminative sparse coding and Conditional Random Field models suggests that the paper may belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) or machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the focus on structured output learning and the use of kinematic data suggest that the paper may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) or robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories. Finally, the evaluation of the proposed method on datasets related to surgical tasks and food preparation suggests that the paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
